description: "Welcome to the Homepage of DevOps with Kubernetes, a comprehensive MOOC offered by the University of Helsinki. The course has been recently updated and the 2024 edition has already begun. However, the official start date is 1st August and university credits will only be awarded after that date. Please note that this course requires attendees to have their own computers with admin/superuser privileges, as it cannot be completed on faculty computers. Registration is only necessary for ECTS credits, and a certificate can

name: Devopswithdocker
description: This course, titled "DevOps with Docker", is designed to provide an introduction to container technologies, with a specific focus on Docker and container orchestration using Docker Compose. Containers are a lightweight and portable way to package and deploy software applications. Throughout the course, students will learn about the various components of web services, such as reverse proxies and databases, and how they can be deployed using Docker. Please note that due to technical limitations, Docker cannot be installed on Department of Computer Science computers, so students will need to use their own computers to follow the examples and complete the exercises. To be successful in this course, attendees should have access to a computer with admin/superuser privileges and a general understanding of software development concepts.

description: The CMU School of Computer Science is a highly esteemed program at Carnegie Mellon University, known for producing innovative problem-solvers who improve the world we live in. They are currently seeking qualified applicants for faculty positions and offer a variety of programs to train the next generation of computer science leaders. The school also stays up-to-date with the latest technology, as seen through their recent launch of a coding bootcamp and their use of a new engine tool. Additionally, they prioritize giving back to the community through their donation program. Stay informed about their latest news and upcoming events through their website.

name: Inventwithpython
description: Invent with Python is a website that offers free resources for learning how to program. The website is run by Al Sweigart, who is an author and educator in the field of coding. The website offers a variety of books, including "Automate the Boring Stuff with Python" and "Python Programming Exercises, Gently Explained", which are designed to teach beginners how to code in a fun and accessible way. The website also offers a weekly mailing list for news and updates on new books and resources. Whether you're a student, office worker, or hobbyist, learning to program with Python can make you a smarter and more capable individual. With Al Sweigart's approach, programming becomes less intimidating and more enjoyable, allowing you to

name: Contrastchecker
description: This web scrape text is about a tool called "WCAG - Contrast Checker" that allows users to check the contrast of their color designs for accessibility based on the Web Content Accessibility Guideline (WCAG). The tool is provided by Acart Communications and was last updated on September 27, 2017. Users can select foreground and background colors, get colors from an image, and see a grayscale version. They can also share and reset samples in different font sizes. The tool also has a feature to add images and save a history of color selections. The contrast ratio is displayed in AA and AAA levels, with 18pt being the recommended size. The tool also shows the color difference and allows users to save a PDF of their results. Overall

name: Eventbrite
description: Eventbrite is a website that helps you discover the most exciting and engaging local events and activities. From concerts and workshops to yoga classes and charity events, you can easily find tickets to your next unforgettable experience. Whether you're looking for a fun night out, a cultural experience, or a new hobby, Eventbrite has something for everyone. With a wide range of events including music festivals, food festivals, and holiday celebrations, you'll never run out of things to do. Unfortunately, the website may not be compatible with older versions of Internet Explorer, so it's recommended to upgrade your browser for the best experience. Start browsing now and find your next event in no time!

name: Google
description: Google Chrome is the ultimate web browser designed by Google to provide users with a fast, secure, and personalized browsing experience. With its advanced features and customizable options, Chrome is the go-to choice for internet users. Whether you're using Windows, macOS, or any other operating system, Chrome has got you covered. Download now and make it yours.

name: Interviewguide
description: Welcome to InterviewGuide.dev, a free online resource for software development interviews! This comprehensive guide was created by Nick, a senior software engineer at Microsoft with over 100 interviews under his belt. Whether you're a candidate or an interviewer, this guide offers valuable insights and tips for navigating the interview process. Nick's experience spans both big tech companies and smaller startups, making this guide applicable to a wide range of industries. Rest assured that all information presented here is based on Nick's personal views and not those of any employer. And the best part? This guide will always be free for anyone to access. If you find it helpful, consider showing your support by giving the repository a star on GitHub. Whether you're new to software engineering or a seasoned

name: Craftinginterpreters
description: "Crafting Interpreters" is a comprehensive guide for those interested in creating their own programming language. This book covers everything from high-level concepts to technical details, including parsing, semantics, bytecode representation, and garbage collection. With hands-on exercises and detailed explanations, readers will gain a deep understanding of the language-building process. The book is available in multiple formats, including a beautifully designed print version, an ebook with full-color syntax highlighting, and a Kindle edition. Whether you're a beginner or an experienced programmer, "Crafting Interpreters" will ignite your creativity and leave you with a thorough understanding of language design.

name: Nostarch
description: No Starch Press is a popular online bookstore that offers a wide range of books on various topics such as art and design, general computing, hacking and computer security, hardware and DIY, kids' books, Linux and BSD, manga, programming, Python, science and math, Scratch, and system administration. They also offer early access to upcoming titles and a free ebook edition with every print book purchase. Some of their bestsellers this month include "The Book of Batch Scripting" for Windows users, "R for the Rest of Us" for data analysis, "Computer Architecture" for understanding the inner workings of modern computers, and "Windows Security Internals" for improving Windows security skills. With expert guidance and real-world examples, No Starch

name: Slack
description: Slack is a powerful productivity platform that revolutionizes team communication. It offers a faster, more organized, and secure alternative to email. With Slack, you can easily chat, send audio and video clips, and even hold live discussions with your team. The platform also allows you to streamline your workflow by automating routine tasks with the help of generative AI and integrating all your favorite apps. You have the flexibility to work whenever, wherever, and however you want. At the core of Slack are channels, which bring your team together and make it easier to connect and collaborate across departments, offices, time zones, and even other companies. It's no wonder that teams of all sizes, including some of the world's biggest companies, rely on Slack for

name: Pygame
description: "Stay up to date with the latest news and updates from the world of Pygame! With the release of Pygame 2.6.0 on June 25, 2024, there are exciting new features and improvements to explore. Simply install the update with python3 -m pip install -U pygame==2.6.0 and check out the release notes for a full list of changes. And don't forget to report any issues you may encounter on the official Pygame GitHub page. But that's not all - previous versions like Pygame 2.5.2, 2.5.1, and 2.5.0 also have their own unique updates and bug fixes. Plus, get involved in the

name: Lifetechpsych
description: LifeTechPsych is a comprehensive learning hub for new and junior developers, providing valuable tips and insights from books, research, and over 10 years of coding experience. Our philosophy combines technology and psychology to help you save time and avoid common mistakes. We offer a free dev cheatsheet and regularly share the latest notes on topics such as transitioning from beginner to intermediate programmer, choosing between freeCodeCamp and The Odin Project, and the role of math in coding. Our blog also features personal stories from self-taught web developers and fun programming projects for beginners. Whether you're just starting out or looking to improve your skills, LifeTechPsych is here to guide you on your coding journey.

name: Phaser
description: Phaser is a powerful and versatile game framework that allows developers of all levels to create exciting games for both desktop and mobile devices. With its fast and free open source platform, Phaser makes it easy to build Canvas and WebGL powered browser games. Whether you're a beginner or an experienced developer, Phaser offers a range of resources to help you get started, including a free book, tutorials, and a comprehensive API documentation. For a more visual approach, you can use Phaser Editor to easily drag and drop game objects, adjust animations, and add special effects. With over 2000 examples and a supportive community, Phaser is the go-to choice for creating HTML5 games. So why wait? Register for an account and start creating your own games with Phaser today

name: Monogame
description: MonoGame is a powerful framework that allows you to create cross-platform games with ease. With the ability to write code in C# and other .NET languages, you can create modern, fast, and reliable games using your preferred editor. Whether you use Visual Studio, Visual Studio Code, or JetBrains Rider, MonoGame has you covered. It also offers cross-platform building, allowing you to export your game to multiple platforms such as Windows, MacOS, Linux, Android, iOS, iPadOS, Playstation, Xbox, and Nintendo Switch. And with its open-source nature, you have the freedom to make changes and even port your game to new platforms. Developed by the MonoGame Foundation, the MonoGame Framework is completely free and accessible to all.

name: Repl
description: Replit is a powerful software development and deployment platform that utilizes AI technology to help users build, share, and ship software at a faster pace. With Replit Guides, users can easily follow step-by-step instructions to create AI models, build chatbots, and launch websites. The platform offers a single cloud workspace with built-in AI, allowing users to create and deploy websites, automations, internal tools, data pipes, and more in any programming language without the need for additional tools or setup. Replit is trusted by businesses and organizations, such as SUPERAGENT.SH and Weights and Biases, for its ability to quickly prototype and test new features before pushing them to production. With Replit, users have everything they need to build software in one
